title: EPISTOLA James Kottemann
html:
EPISTOLA James Kottemann

In VERBATIM vol. XXIV, page 27, the author writes: “words that each have completely opposite meanings, like cleave, ravel, or sanction.” I have known of several others of this group, none of which I can now remember. Is there a term for words in this group?

[James Kottemann, JIMLUDDITE@webtv.net]

[I've heard two terms for this group: contronyms and Janus-words—Ed. (With thanks to Joe Pickett of American Heritage)]
